text.p: Following are the main stories in Slovenia's Tuesday morning newspapers:
- Railway employees stage a four-hour warning strike to demand higher salaries.

- A two-day conference on investment opportunities in the Central European Free Trade Area (CEFTA), including Slovenia, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Poland and Hungary, started in New York on Monday.

- The Austrian parliament's speaker Heinz Fischer said the assembly supported Slovenia's bid to join the European Union and NATO as soon as possible. Fischer met his Slovenian counterpart Janez Podobnik in Vienna on Monday.
- Petrol trader Petrol was listed on the main market of the Ljubljana bourse on Monday, when its shares fell 4.6 percent from the opening price of 18,000 tolars.
- Foreign Minister Zoran Thaler will participate at a ministerial meeting of the Council of Europe in Strasbourg on Tuesday.
- Newspaper Delo has launched an Internet website for its main stories.
- Police discovered a group of 14 people who were smuggling cigarettes, alcohol and arms.
- Coal mine Zagorje, which stopped production last year, will be closed by the year 2001.
